thread.title: Friday's high schools: 100th win at Pittsfield for girls soccer coach Waluszko
thread.title_full: Friday's high schools: 100th win at Pittsfield for girls soccer coach Waluszko

author:
Berkshire Eagle Staff
sports@berkshireeagle.com , @EagleSportsZone on Twitter
title: Friday's high schools: 100th win at Pittsfield for girls soccer coach Waluszko
text:
P — Quinn Matthews (Shane Tierney), 8:00. 
Second Half P — Jamie Rosiello (UA), 43:00; Louis Higuera (Grady Pedersen), 64:00; Higuera (Pedersen), 66:00; Jesse Kramer (Mike Holmes), 73:00; Carter Matthews (Nate Robarge), 76:00. Saves: P — Jon Bile 2. T — Cody Latimer 12. Golf 
PITTSFIELD 163, MONUMENT 191 
At the Country Club of Pittsfield, the Generals rebounded from their season's first loss, getting co-medalist honors from Justin Martin and Jake Driscoll. Both shot a 40 on the par-35 front nine. 
"We were playing really well. We have been all year," PHS coach Chris Polidoro said. "They didn't have too many big numbers and they were really consistent out there." 
Pittsfield's Kevin Quinto and Monument's Dylan Buffoni each shot 41s in the cold, rainy weather. Pittsfield is now 8-1. 
——— PITTSFIELD (163): Kevin Quinto 41, Thomas Symanski 54, Ricky Berrian 42, Justin Martin 40, Jake Driscoll 40, Connor McDonough 46. MONUMENT (191): Dylan Buffoni 41, Aaron Coons 43, Lexi Shumsky 58, Max Joyner 61, Matt Iemolini 53, Dylan Tinker 54. 
HOOSAC 168, TACONIC 173 
At Forest Park Country Club, Hoosac eighth grader Henry Sniezek and Taconic's Brett Murphy earned co-medalist honors with 39s on the par-34 course, but Hoosac's consistency gave it the win. 
The Hurricanes' (5-5) Jack Sniezek, Nate Lapine and Derek Alibozek all shot 43s. 
"The consistency for us today was the key. This is our best score so far this year," Hoosac coach Jay Sniezek said. "[Henry] really wants to improve his game and he really works at it. I'd say his focus is the key." 
——— TACONIC (173): Kyle Rochelo 44, Ross Omelenchuck 49, Mike Kays 41, Brett Murphy 39, Tim Curry 53, Connor Champoux 52. HOOSAC (168): Jack Sniezek 43, Nate Lapine 43, Derek Alibozek 43, Hayden Grimes 50, Henry Sniezek 39, Luc Trombley 53. Birdies: Lapine (No. 9), Alibozek (No. 9), Kays (No. 9), Murphy (No. 8). 
ST. JOSEPH 170, WAHCONAH 173 
At Pontoosuc Lake Country Club, Wahconah's Jonathan Dos Santos earned medalist honors with a 37. Andy Cella (41) and the Crusaders, though, earned the home win on the par-35 front nine. 
"It was cold and windy for a while," St. Joe coach Fran Brilliant said. "Both teams played really, really well. [Dos Santos] went really low today. I was very impressed with a lot of quality golf shots today." 
St. Joe is now 5-5. 
——— ST. JOE (170): Andy Cella 41, Brent Arseneau 44, Cody Tynan 43, Jacob Felix 48, Michael Gingras 42, Connor Thurston 63. WAHCONAH (173): Gage Frazier 43, Andrew Beaudoin 45, Jonathan Dos Santos 37, Colette Basiliere 49, Thomas Gonzales 50, Mike Shea 48. Birdies: Dos Santos (No. 7), Frazier (No. 2). 
MOUNT GREYLOCK 169, MOUNT EVERETT 204 
At Egremont Country Club, Matt Wiseman's 39 earned him medalist honors and gave the Mounties the win on the par-34 front nine. 
Jake Christinat shot a 45 to lead Mount Everett. 
"Very cold, wet and windy," Eagles coach Fred Finkle said. "It rained here most of the match." 
——— GREYLOCK (169): Matt Wiseman 39, Ben Gilooly 41, Kyle Alvarez 41, Lily Crolius 48, Bennett Zimmerman 51, Owen Jones 49. EVERETT (204): Jake Christinat 45, Christian Wells 48, Sean Smith 59, Patrick Hogelin 73, Anthony Consolini 52, Ethan Beniot 64. Birdies: None. Volleyball 
TACONIC 3, ST. JOSEPH 0 
At Taconic, Julia Kalinowsky's 23 assists, two kills and two blocks led the way to a 25-15, 25-15, 25-20 win. 
Sam Wehry had five kills and a block for Taconic (3-6), while Hannah Mitchell had five aces and five kills. For St. Joe, Leanne Hamilton had eight aces, four digs, four assists and two kills; Ilyssa Creamer had four digs, three aces and two kills; and Pookie Vongprommool had three kills and three digs. 
"We played well all around and they were using all the players on the court, which was nice," Braves coach Jen Doerle said. 
WAHCONAH 3, MOUNT ANTHONY 0 
At Dalton, the Warriors improved to 7-2 with a 25-9, 25-13, 25-17 sweep. 
Hailey Parker had 14 assists and six aces for WRHS, followed by Taylor Phillips' four kills and two aces, and Audrey Pierce's three kills and two digs. 
Wahconah is now off until next Friday at Pittsfield. 
"We'll have a good week of practice, only having the one [match]," WRHS coach Dave Lussier said. "We have a couple of injuries we'll be able to mend during that time." 
MONUMENT MOUNTAIN 3, LENOX 1 
At Lenox, the visitors prevailed 21-25, 25-19, 25-23, 25-16 behind 11 digs and eight kills from Brianna Davis. 
Siobhan Yaple added eight assists, four aces, three kills and two digs in the win, with Alianne Schatz registering 11 digs, two kills and two assists. 
For Lenox, Anna Lynch had 16 digs and three aces; Riley Burke had 11 digs and two kills; and Cami Smachetti had 12 kills, five digs and four aces. 
"It was a really upsetting game, to say the least," Lenox coach Bessena Cabe said. "They were tipping the ball above our middle blockers. They were using the center court to their advantage, and we had a little trouble covering that."
